Name: INSTRUMENT_HEADER
Comments: If this L2 file was translated from an instrument’s native data product then this header contains the original data header

Name: RECEIPT
Description: Table of operations that have been performed on this file
Comments: Table has columns: time; code release; branch name; commit hash; function; args; status.

Name: DRP_CONFIG
Description: Pipeline details (settings etc) to go from native data to L2
Comments: Table has one column where each row captures a config entry

Name: EXT_DESCRIPT
Description: Table describing contents of each extension
Comments: Table has two columns and each one row contains the name of an extension in the HDU and then a string description of what is in that extension

Name: ORDER_TABLE
Description: Table capturing the wavelength extent of each order in Trace 1
Comments: Required columns: physical echelle order, index echelle order, start wavelength, end wavelength.

Name: TRACE1_FLUX
Comments: Shape is NxM where N is number of orders (NUMORDER keyword in PRIMARY header) and M is the number of pixels in the dispersion direction.

Name: TRACE1_WAVE
Comments: Shape matches TRACE1_FLUX. Wavelengths should be in vaccuum. Set any undefined wavelength values - e.g. orders that are not currently extracted - to be NaN.

Name: TRACE1_VAR
Comments: Shape matches TRACE1_FLUX

Name: TRACE1_BLAZE
Comments: Shape matches TRACE1_FLUX. Use the BLZNORM keyword in the TRACE1_BLAZE extension header to identify whether or not the blaze has been normalized.

Name: BARYCORR_KMS
Comments: Shape should convey how this is applied to the wavelength solution – can be a single value in which case 1 correction for whole array; can be an array of Norders in which case there is a different correction for each order; or can be array of Nord x Mpix in which case there is a different correction for each pixel

Name: BARYCORR_Z
Comments: Shape approach matches BARRYCORR_KMS

Name: BJD_TDB
Comments: Shape approach matches BARRYCORR_KMS

Name: TRACE1_DRIFT
Description: Drift measurement map in delta lambda
Comments: Shape approach matches BARRYCORR_KMS

Name: TRACE1_QUALITY
Description: Quality of each pixel in trace 1
Comments: Shape matches TRACE1_FLUX. Recommend convention that 0 is the no flag value

Name: EXPMETER
Description: Table of exposure meter counts timeseries over the exposure
Comments: Table has number of columns equal to the number of wavelengths where the exposure counts are measured and number of rows equal to exposure time / exp meter cadence

Name: TELEMETRY
Description: Table of telemetry collected during the exposure
Comments: Table has 4 columns: time stamp; sensor name; value; units

Name: TRACE1_TELLURIC
Comments: Shape matches TRACE1_FLUX. Generally used for Science Object traces

Name: TRACE1_SKYMODEL
Comments: Shape matches TRACE1_FLUX. Generally used for Science Object traces

Name: ANCILLARY_SPECTRUM
Comments: Options include Ca II H&K if separate spectrograph used

Name: IMAGE
Description: Extension(s) that store useful support images
Comments: Options include guider cam or sky monitoring or pupil image

Name: CUSTOM1_TRACE1_FLUX
Description: Additionally custom corrected flux for trace 1
Comments: Could include additional corrections such as telluric or sky corrections. Shape matches TRACE1_FLUX.

Name: CUSTOM1_TRACE1_WAVE
Comments: Wavelength solution corresponding to CUSTOM1_TRACE1_FLUX. Shape matches TRACE1_FLUX. Wavelengths should be in vaccuum. Set any undefined wavelength values - e.g. orders that are not currently extracted - to be NaN.

Name: CUSTOM1_TRACE1_VAR
Comments: Variance of the CUSTOM1_TRACE1_FLUX flux array. Shape matches TRACE1_FLUX.
